data_sources.description: A classic dataset containing samples of iris flowers with features like sepal length, sepal width, petal length, and petal width, along with a target variable for species classification.

data_variables.description: Data object that contains the iris dataset, which includes both features and target variable.
Logistic regression model instance, used for training and predictions.
Leave-One-Out cross-validation object used for evaluating the model performance.
Array storing the evaluation scores from cross-validation.

data_flow.creation: Loaded using load_iris() from sklearn datasets.
data_flow.flow: Used as input features and target for the model training.

data_flow.creation: Created as an instance of LogisticRegression with max_iter=1000.
data_flow.flow: Trained using cross-validation with the iris dataset.

data_flow.creation: Created as an instance of LeaveOneOut.
data_flow.flow: Used as the cross-validation strategy for model evaluation.

data_flow.creation: Generated using cross_val_score with the logistic regression model and cv=loo.
data_flow.flow: Used to determine the model's performance, printed to output.

models.input_features: iris.data (sepal length, sepal width, petal length, petal width)
